links.title: Resistance Money
links.description: It examines bitcoin's monetary policy, censorship-resistance, privacy, inclusion, and energy use to develop a comprehensive and measured case that bitcoin is a net benefit to the world, despite its imperfections.

links.title: Broken Money
links.description: Broken Money explores the history of money through the lens of technology. Politics can affect things temporarily and locally, but technology is what drives things forward globally and permanently.

links.title: The Bitcoin Standard
links.description: The Bitcoin Standard analyzes the economic properties that have allowed it to grow quickly, and its likely economic, political, and social implications.

links.title: The Sovereign Individual
links.description: The Sovereign Individual details strategies necessary for adapting financially to the next phase of Western civilization.

links.title: Layered Money
links.description: From Gold and Dollars to Bitcoin and Central Bank Digital Currencies.

links.title: Bitcoin: Everything Divided by 21 Million
links.description: Imagine, everything there is and everything that will ever be, divided by 21 million.

links.title: The Hidden Cost of Money
links.description: Tired of the financial struggle? This book, tailored to ordinary folks, investigates how our monetary system shapes who we are and how we act, and what we can do to create positive change.

links.title: Gradually, Then Suddenly
links.description: Gradually, Then Suddenly is a framework for understanding bitcoin as money, built on a foundation of reason and logic.

links.title: 21 Lessons
links.description: What I've Learned from Falling Down the Bitcoin Rabbit Hole.

links.title: Bitcoin is Venice
links.description: Crash course through the errors of modern economic theory and the world's broken fiat currency system with a hopeful destination: Bitcoin Is Venice.

links.title: Bitcoin: A Work in Progress
links.description: This book will guide you through the latest developments in Bitcoin, as seen through the eyes of one of its many developers.
